member.name: T:AForge.Math.FourierTransform
member.summary: Fourier transformation.
member.remarks: The class implements one dimensional and two dimensional Discrete and Fast Fourier Transformation.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.FourierTransform.DFT(AForge.Math.Complex[],AForge.Math.FourierTransform.Direction)
member.summary: One dimensional Discrete Fourier Transform.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.FourierTransform.DFT2(AForge.Math.Complex[0:,0:],AForge.Math.FourierTransform.Direction)
member.summary: Two dimensional Discrete Fourier Transform.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.FourierTransform.FFT(AForge.Math.Complex[],AForge.Math.FourierTransform.Direction)
member.summary: One dimensional Fast Fourier Transform.

para.note: The method accepts array of 2n size only, where n may vary in the [1, 14] range.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.FourierTransform.FFT2(AForge.Math.Complex[0:,0:],AForge.Math.FourierTransform.Direction)
member.summary: Two dimensional Fast Fourier Transform.

para.note: The method accepts array of 2n size only in each dimension, where n may vary in the [1, 14] range. For example, 16x16 array is valid, but 15x15 is not.

member.name: T:AForge.Math.FourierTransform.Direction
member.summary: Fourier transformation direction.

member.name: F:AForge.Math.FourierTransform.Direction.Forward
member.summary: Forward direction of Fourier transformation.

member.name: F:AForge.Math.FourierTransform.Direction.Backward
member.summary: Backward direction of Fourier transformation.

member.name: T:AForge.Math.ContinuousHistogram
member.summary: Histogram for continuous random values.

remarks.para: The class wraps histogram for continuous stochastic function, which is represented by integer array and range of the function. Values of the integer array are treated as total amount of hits on the corresponding subranges, which are calculated by splitting the specified range into required amount of consequent ranges.
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Math.ContinuousHistogram.#ctor(System.Int32[],AForge.DoubleRange)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: Values of the integer array are treated as total amount of hits on the corresponding subranges, which are calculated by splitting the specified range into required amount of consequent ranges (see class description for more information).

member.name: M:AForge.Math.ContinuousHistogram.GetRange(System.Double)
member.summary: Get range around median containing specified percentage of values.
member.returns: Returns the range which containes specifies percentage of values.

remarks.para: The method calculates range of stochastic variable, which summary probability comprises the specified percentage of histogram's hits.
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Math.ContinuousHistogram.Update
member.summary: Update statistical value of the histogram.
member.remarks: The method recalculates statistical values of the histogram, like mean, standard deviation, etc. The method should be called only in the case if histogram values were retrieved through property and updated after that.

member.name: P:AForge.Math.ContinuousHistogram.Values
member.summary: Values of the histogram.

member.name: P:AForge.Math.ContinuousHistogram.Range
member.summary: Range of random values.

member.name: P:AForge.Math.ContinuousHistogram.Mean
member.summary: Mean value.

remarks.para: The property allows to retrieve mean value of the histogram.
Sample usage:

member.name: P:AForge.Math.ContinuousHistogram.StdDev
member.summary: Standard deviation.

remarks.para: The property allows to retrieve standard deviation value of the histogram.
Sample usage:

member.name: P:AForge.Math.ContinuousHistogram.Median
member.summary: Median value.

remarks.para: The property allows to retrieve median value of the histogram.
Sample usage:

member.name: P:AForge.Math.ContinuousHistogram.Min
member.summary: Minimum value.

remarks.para: The property allows to retrieve minimum value of the histogram with non zero hits count.
Sample usage:

member.name: P:AForge.Math.ContinuousHistogram.Max
member.summary: Maximum value.

remarks.para: The property allows to retrieve maximum value of the histogram with non zero hits count.
Sample usage:

member.name: T:AForge.Math.Tools
member.summary: Set of tool functions.
member.remarks: The class contains different utility functions.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Tools.Pow2(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates power of 2.
member.returns: Returns specified power of 2 in the case if power is in the range of [0, 30]. Otherwise returns 0.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Tools.IsPowerOf2(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the specified integer is power of 2.
member.returns: Returns true if the specified number is power of 2. Otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Tools.Log2(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get base of binary logarithm.
member.returns: Power of the number (base of binary logarithm).

member.name: T:AForge.Math.Random.IRandomNumberGenerator
member.summary: Interface for random numbers generators.

remarks.para: The interface defines set of methods and properties, which should be implemented by different algorithms for random numbers generatation.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Random.IRandomNumberGenerator.Next
member.summary: Generate next random number.
member.returns: Returns next random number.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Random.IRandomNumberGenerator.SetSeed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set seed of the random numbers generator.

member.name: P:AForge.Math.Random.IRandomNumberGenerator.Mean
member.summary: Mean value of generator.

member.name: P:AForge.Math.Random.IRandomNumberGenerator.Variance
member.summary: Variance value of generator.

member.name: T:AForge.Math.Statistics
member.summary: Set of statistics functions.
member.remarks: The class represents collection of simple functions used in statistics.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Statistics.Mean(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Calculate mean value.
member.returns: Returns mean value.

remarks.para: The input array is treated as histogram, i.e. its indexes are treated as values of stochastic function, but array values are treated as "probabilities" (total amount of hits).
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Statistics.StdDev(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Calculate standard deviation.
member.returns: Returns value of standard deviation.

remarks.para: The input array is treated as histogram, i.e. its indexes are treated as values of stochastic function, but array values are treated as "probabilities" (total amount of hits).
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Statistics.Median(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Calculate median value.
member.returns: Returns value of median.

remarks.para: The input array is treated as histogram, i.e. its indexes are treated as values of stochastic function, but array values are treated as "probabilities" (total amount of hits).

para.note: The median value is calculated accumulating histogram's values starting from the left point until the sum reaches 50% of histogram's sum.

remarks.para: Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Statistics.GetRange(System.Int32[],System.Double)
member.summary: Get range around median containing specified percentage of values.
member.returns: Returns the range which containes specifies percentage of values.

remarks.para: The input array is treated as histogram, i.e. its indexes are treated as values of stochastic function, but array values are treated as "probabilities" (total amount of hits).
The method calculates range of stochastic variable, which summary probability comprises the specified percentage of histogram's hits.
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Statistics.Entropy(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Calculate entropy value.
member.returns: Returns entropy value of the specified histagram array.

remarks.para: The input array is treated as histogram, i.e. its indexes are treated as values of stochastic function, but array values are treated as "probabilities" (total amount of hits).
Sample usage:

member.name: T:AForge.Math.Random.UniformGenerator
member.summary: Uniform random numbers generator.

remarks.para: The random numbers generator generates uniformly distributed numbers in the specified range - values are greater or equal to minimum range's value and less than maximum range's value.
The generator uses generator to generate random numbers.
Sample usage:

member.name: T:AForge.Math.PerlinNoise
member.summary: Perlin noise function.

remarks.para: The class implements 1-D and 2-D Perlin noise functions, which represent sum of several smooth noise functions with different frequency and amplitude. The description of Perlin noise function and its calculation may be found on Hugo Elias's page.

The number of noise functions, which comprise the resulting Perlin noise function, is set by property. Amplitude and frequency values for each octave start from values, which are set by and properties.
Sample usage (clouds effect):

member.name: M:AForge.Math.PerlinNoise.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.PerlinNoise.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.PerlinNoise.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.PerlinNoise.Function(System.Double)
member.summary: 1-D Perlin noise function.
member.returns: Returns function's value at point .

member.name: M:AForge.Math.PerlinNoise.Function2D(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: 2-D Perlin noise function.
member.returns: Returns function's value at point (, ).

member.name: M:AForge.Math.PerlinNoise.Noise(System.Int32)
member.summary: Ordinary noise function

member.name: M:AForge.Math.PerlinNoise.SmoothedNoise(System.Double)
member.summary: Smoothed noise.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.PerlinNoise.CosineInterpolate(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Cosine interpolation.

member.name: P:AForge.Math.PerlinNoise.InitFrequency
member.summary: Initial frequency.

remarks.para:
The property sets initial frequency of the first octave. Frequencies for next octaves are calculated using the next equation:
frequencyi = * 2i, where i = [0, ).
Default value is set to 1.

member.name: P:AForge.Math.PerlinNoise.InitAmplitude
member.summary: Initial amplitude.

remarks.para:
The property sets initial amplitude of the first octave. Amplitudes for next octaves are calculated using the next equation:
amplitudei = * i, where i = [0, ).
Default value is set to 1.

member.name: P:AForge.Math.PerlinNoise.Persistence
member.summary: Persistence value.

remarks.para: The property sets so called persistence value, which controls the way how amplitude is calculated for each octave comprising the Perlin noise function.
Default value is set to 0.65.

member.name: P:AForge.Math.PerlinNoise.Octaves
member.summary: Number of octaves, [1, 32].

remarks.para: The property sets the number of noise functions, which sum up the resulting Perlin noise function.
Default value is set to 4.

member.name: T:AForge.Math.Gaussian
member.summary: Gaussian function.

remarks.para: The class is used to calculate 1D and 2D Gaussian functions for specified (s) value:
remarks.code:
1-D: f(x) = exp( x * x / ( -2 * s * s ) ) / ( s * sqrt( 2 * PI ) )
2-D: f(x, y) = exp( x * x + y * y / ( -2 * s * s ) ) / ( s * s * 2 * PI )

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Gaussian.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Gaussian.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Gaussian.Function(System.Double)
member.summary: 1-D Gaussian function.
member.returns: Returns function's value at point .

remarks.para: The function calculates 1-D Gaussian function:
remarks.code: f(x) = exp( x * x / ( -2 * s * s ) ) / ( s * sqrt( 2 * PI ) )

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Gaussian.Function2D(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: 2-D Gaussian function.
member.returns: Returns function's value at point (, ).

remarks.para: The function calculates 2-D Gaussian function:
remarks.code: f(x, y) = exp( x * x + y * y / ( -2 * s * s ) ) / ( s * s * 2 * PI )

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Gaussian.Kernel(System.Int32)
member.summary: 1-D Gaussian kernel.
member.returns: Returns 1-D Gaussian kernel of the specified size.

remarks.para: The function calculates 1-D Gaussian kernel, which is array of Gaussian function's values in the [-r, r] range of x value, where r=floor(/2).

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Gaussian.Kernel2D(System.Int32)
member.summary: 2-D Gaussian kernel.
member.returns: Returns 2-D Gaussian kernel of specified size.

remarks.para: The function calculates 2-D Gaussian kernel, which is array of Gaussian function's values in the [-r, r] range of x,y values, where r=floor(/2).

member.name: P:AForge.Math.Gaussian.Sigma
member.summary: Sigma value.

remarks.para: Sigma property of Gaussian function.
Default value is set to 1. Minimum allowed value is 0.00000001.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Complex.ApproxEqual(AForge.Math.Complex,AForge.Math.Complex)
member.summary: Tests whether two complex numbers are approximately equal using default tolerance value.
member.returns: Return if the two vectors are approximately equal or otherwise.

remarks.para: The default tolerance value, which is used for the test, equals to 8.8817841970012523233891E-16.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Complex.ApproxEqual(AForge.Math.Complex,AForge.Math.Complex,System.Double)
member.summary: Tests whether two complex numbers are approximately equal given a tolerance value.
member.param: The tolerance value used to test approximate equality.

remarks.para: The default tolerance value, which is used for the test, equals to 8.8817841970012523233891E-16.

member.name: P:AForge.Math.Complex.Magnitude
member.summary: Magnitude value of the complex number.

remarks.para: Magnitude of the complex number, which equals to Sqrt( Re * Re + Im * Im ).

member.name: P:AForge.Math.Complex.Phase
member.summary: Phase value of the complex number.

remarks.para: Phase of the complex number, which equals to Atan( Im / Re ).

member.name: P:AForge.Math.Complex.SquaredMagnitude
member.summary: Squared magnitude value of the complex number.

member.name: T:AForge.Math.Random.GaussianGenerator
member.summary: Gaussian random numbers generator.

remarks.para: The random number generator generates gaussian random numbers with specified mean and standard deviation values.
The generator uses generator as base to generate random numbers.
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Random.GaussianGenerator.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Seed value to initialize random numbers generator.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Random.GaussianGenerator.Next
member.summary: Generate next random number.
member.returns: Returns next random number.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Random.GaussianGenerator.SetSeed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set seed of the random numbers generator.
member.remarks: Resets random numbers generator initializing it with specified seed value.

member.summary: Mean value of the generator.

member.name: P:AForge.Math.Random.GaussianGenerator.Variance
member.summary: Variance value of the generator.

member.name: P:AForge.Math.Random.GaussianGenerator.StdDev
member.summary: Standard deviation value.

member.name: T:AForge.Math.Random.StandardGenerator
member.summary: Standard random numbers generator.

remarks.para: The random number generator generates gaussian random numbers with zero mean and standard deviation of one. The generator implements polar form of the Box-Muller transformation.
The generator uses generator as a base to generate random numbers.
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Random.StandardGenerator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.param: Seed value to initialize random numbers generator.

member.summary: Generate next random number.
member.returns: Returns next random number.

member.summary: Set seed of the random numbers generator.
member.remarks: Resets random numbers generator initializing it with specified seed value.

member.summary: Mean value of the generator.

member.summary: Variance value of the generator.

The generator uses generator as a base to generate random numbers.

member.name: T:AForge.Math.Random.UniformOneGenerator
member.summary: Uniform random numbers generator in the range of [0, 1).

remarks.para: The random number generator generates uniformly distributed numbers in the range of [0, 1) - greater or equal to 0.0 and less than 1.0.

para.note: At this point the generator is based on the internal .NET generator, but may be rewritten to use faster generation algorithm.

remarks.para: Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Random.UniformOneGenerator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: Initializes random numbers generator with zero seed.

member.name: M:AForge.Math.Random.UniformOneGenerator.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Seed value to initialize random numbers generator.

member.summary: Generate next random number.
member.returns: Returns next random number.

member.summary: Set seed of the random numbers generator.
member.remarks: Resets random numbers generator initializing it with specified seed value.

member.summary: Mean value of the generator.
